comments:
Build 20020820

Note: The used plug-in names might be familiar. We are working on a separation
of org.eclipse.ui into several plug-ins. If you need the plug-ins to reproduce
the problem I can point you to the corresponding repository.

I have the following setup:
Plug-in org.eclipse.workbench defines PACKAGE VISIBLE
org.eclipse.ui.internal.PlatformUIPreferenceListener

Plug-in org.eclipse.ui uses (declared in plugin.xml) org.eclipse.workbench
Its startup class is in the same package fragment as above class:
org.eclipse.ui.internal.UIPlugin
This class references PlatformUIPreferenceListener

Now:
- compiling works fine
- running the stuff with the Eclipse launcher out of my workspace works fine
- running the it outside Eclipse (i.e. from JARs) does not work, the class
loader throws IllegalAccessError (see below).

When I change the visibility of PlatformUIPreferenceListener to PUBLIC
everything works fine.


Stack Trace:

java.lang.IllegalAccessError: try to access class
org.eclipse.ui.internal.PlatformUIPreferenceListener from class
org.eclipse.ui.internal.UIPlugin
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.UIPlugin.initializeDefaultPreferences(UIPlugin.java:160)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.plugin.AbstractUIPlugin.initializeDefaultPluginPreferences(AbstractUIPlugin.java:618)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Plugin.getPluginPreferences(Plugin.java:347)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.plugin.AbstractUIPlugin$CompatibilityPreferenceStore.initialize(AbstractUIPlugin.java:179)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.plugin.AbstractUIPlugin.getPreferenceStore(AbstractUIPlugin.java:555)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPlugin.getPreferenceStore(WorkbenchPlugin.java:396)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.initializeFonts(Workbench.java:737)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.init(Workbench.java:604)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:1281)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:775)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:462)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:248)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:698)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:534)

This is a duplicate of bug 42853. Classes declared in the same package but
loaded by different classloaders (and each plugin has its own classloader) are
*not* in the same *runtime* package.

For more info, see the Java VM spec 2nd edition, sections 5.3 (Creation and
Loading) and 5.4.4 (Access control).

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 42853 ***

Is it really a duplicate? I think there are two bugs described here. 

The first one ist the visibility problem. That is a duplicate. But the second 
problem indicates that the exception doesn't occure if you are running the code 
from within Eclipse as a Runtime Workbench. Shouldn't the Runtime Workbench 
behave excactly the way a real Eclipse does?

This works for me on Eclipse 3.0 (I don't know when/how it was fixed though). I
get the same IllegalAccessException when launching Eclipse from inside Eclipse.

traces.message: try to access class org.eclipse.ui.internal.PlatformUIPreferenceListener from class org.eclipse.ui.internal.UIPlugin
